sen.j: 明石の御方（あかしのおんかた）は紫式部の物語『源氏物語』に登場する架空の人物。
sen.e: Akashi no onkata, Lady Akashi, is a fictional character appearing in "The Tale of Genji" by Lady Murasaki.
sen.cmt: 明石の御方の日本語の呼び方が複数あるのに対し、英語では通常"Lady Akashi"で統一されているため、セル4～6についてはあえて日本語読みを残し、訳出に適宜「日本語では」と加えました。

sen.e: Her father was the Akashi Priest, who is a cousin of Genji's mother Kiritsubo no Koi, and her mother was the Akashi Nun.

sen.j: 近衛中将の位を捨て明石の受領となり剃髪した入道は、自分の娘から将来天皇と皇后が生まれる（すなわち「国母（天皇の生母）」の母となる）という夢のお告げを信じた。
sen.e: The Akashi Priest, who had abandoned the rank of Konoe no chujo (middle captain of the palace guards), become the governor of a province, settled in Akashi and then taken the tonsure, believed a revelation from a dream that a prospective emperor and empress would be born to his daughter (in other words, his daughter would become the mother of an emperor).

sen.j: そして娘に京の姫君に劣らないほどの教育をほどこし、「もし心ざし遂げずこの宿世違はば海に入りね」と厳しく育てた。
sen.e: He gave his daughter an education of a level as high as the princesses in Kyoto, and reared her strictly, instructing her that 'If we are not able to realize our ambitions and the revelation does not come true, you are to leap into the sea.'
